page.title: 12NATEBY & WHARTON W.I.
page.content: THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE FOR NATEBY & WHARTON,FORMED IN 1947,HOLDS 11 MEETINGS A YEAR. THESE ARE HELD IN THE VILLAGE HALL, PREVIOUSLY THE SCHOOL AT NATEBY, ON THE FIRST FRIDAY EACH MONTH THE MEMBERSHIP,IN CONTRAST TO THE NATIONAL DECLINE IS THRIVING, WITH 48 NAMES ON THE REGISTER.MEMBERS COME FROM NATEBY,MALLERSTANG,KIRKBY STEPHEN AND FURTHER AFIELD. SPEAKERS AND DEM- ONSTRATORS ARE INVITED AND TOPICS COVERED RANGE FROM TRADITIONAL COUNTRY CRAFTS TO PRESENT-DAY SOCIAL ISSUES, E.G.DRUG ABUSE.THE MEETINGS ALWAYS END WITH THE OPPORTUNITY FOR SOCIAL INTER- CHANGE.ANNUAL EVENTS INCLUDE 1 MONEY- RAISING EFFORT FOR THE INSTITUTE EXPENSES,ANOTHER FOR A CHARITY,A NEW- YEAR PARTY, A SUMMER WALK AND SEVERAL OUTINGS. MANY MEMBERS PARTAKE IN COUNTY EVENTS.
